Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                                                     M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media          feature subtitle 1          feature text                             The M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media , offered through the NYU School of Professional Studies Center for Publishing, provides you with a solid foundation in book and magazine publishing, with a major focus on digital media. The program develops the core competencies of content creation and editing, while also emphasizing the business, digital media, and marketing skills that are necessary to secure leadership roles in the industry.   With a goal of exposing you to "real-world, real-workplace" scenarios, the curriculum reflects the most current industry trends, including best practices in e-books, apps, and mobile platforms and video. Your studies begin with core courses that provide a comprehensive framework in the essential elements of the publishing process. Media specialization courses delve into the most critical business aspects of the industry and provide the expertise needed to master them.       The core course requirements are designed to provide you with an in-depth understanding of the most important elements of publishing. While completing the core courses, you also take courses from three media specializations: media content development, media marketing and distribution, and media profitability. Advanced seminars provide a thorough exploration of key industry topics. You complete the program with a capstone project that allows you to draw on the skills you’ve acquired.   While rigorous coursework is key to your success in the program, you also will be provided with numerous opportunities to expand your publishing knowledge outside of the classroom. In addition to industry events and visits, the M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media has developed a strong global program. As the publishing industry becomes not only more digital, but global, an understanding of international publishing practices is imperative. Students are invited to apply for trips to international book fairs and conferences, where they can volunteer their time in return for the opportunity to participate in global events and discussions. In recent years, students have served as marketing, publicity, and educational programming volunteers at the Frankfurt, London, Abu Dhabi, and Sharjah (UAE) international book fairs and at the FIPP International Magazine conference in Rome. These opportunities are underwritten by department grants for a select number of students.           Program Location : NYU Midtown Center                 From the Director                                                       Andrea Chambers        "Our goal is to prepare today’s professional for success and career satisfaction."          Read More                      Specializations           Media Content Development         Media Marketing and Distribution         Media Profitability                 View General Curriculum            Learn More            NYU School of Professional Studies faculty and staff members look forward to learning more about you, and we want you to learn more about us, to ensure that your decisions regarding your educational experience are well informed. Our admissions staff is here to partner with you throughout the admissions process. Please do not hesitate to contact us .                   Ready to Proceed? Summer Publishing Institute                                                                                          The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                       Center for Publishing                                                                                           About             Director's Message Faculty Advisory Board News Watch Videos                   Admissions                 Academics             Graduate Offerings Noncredit Offerings Summer Publishing Institute Advanced Digital Publishing Institute                   Career                 Events             NYU Media Talk                   Initiatives             Publisher's Training Program                   Alumni                                                   Summer Publishing Institute (SPI)                                            Academics ›                Graduate Offerings            Noncredit Offerings            Summer Publishing Institute            Advanced Digital Publishing Institute            Watch Videos                                                                                                  Summer Publishing Institute                               More Information          2015 Program Brochure      NYU Pub Posts      Contact Us by E-mail             Apply Now        The Summer Publishing Institute immerses students in an intense, six-week study of book, magazine, and digital publishing. Now entering its 37th year, the program combines workshops, strategy sessions, and presentations by some of the leading figures in publishing. Our faculty members and speakers introduce students to the editorial, marketing, creative, business, sales, and digital aspects of the industry. The program also places a large emphasis on using editorial and media skills in a wider range of media brands such as pure digital and e-commerce companies.     Students create actual launch plans for new magazine brands and imprints for book publishing houses, and learn from having their projects judged by a panel of senior publishing executives. At the conclusion of the program, students attend a Career Fair where they interview with some of the nation's leading publishing companies.   The Summer Publishing Institute is designed for recent college graduates and for young professionals who are interested in careers in book and magazine publishing.         For application-related questions, please contact the Admissions Office at (212) 998-7100 , or at scps.gradadmissions@nyu.edu . For other questions, please e-mail pub.center@nyu.edu .                   Ready to Proceed?          Apply Now      Request Information      Attend an Information Session        Please Note : Under the application information section of the online application , select "Matriculant" for application type. Select the "Special Matriculant Programs" for the Program, and "Summer Publishing Institute" for the Anticipated Degree.
